3133.questionText: In comments which alluded to Brexit and Donald Trump's failure to endorse NATO's mutual defence pledge at the G7 this week, _______ stated that Europeans must "take our destiny into our own hands".

3134.questionText: Exelon Corp's Three Mile Island atomic power plant, the site of America's worst commercial nuclear accident in _____, will close in 2019 after losing money for five years.

3135.questionText: Former Panamanian dictator ______, whose ties to drug trafficking led to his ouster by American forces in 1989, died at the age of 83.

3136.questionText: Lebanon banned the new "_______" film, because the main character is played by an Israeli actress, Gal Gadot.

3137.questionText: Some big pension funds are urging _____'s shareholders to reject several company directors and "exorbitant" compensation for its top executives after last year's EpiPen pricing scandal.

3138.questionText: This week the statue of _______ in Denmark was painted red in an apparent protest of whale hunting on the Faeroe Islands.

3139.questionText: A new ad campaign for Burger King has offended _____'s royal family. The fast-food giant, which is opening its first outlet in the country, is asking citizens to visit a website to choose between their king and the company's mascot.

3140.questionText: Opposition leaders in Venezuela criticised ______ for having bought $2.8bn worth of "hunger" bonds issued by the state oil firm at a fire-sale price.

3141.questionText: A high-speed railway, the Madaraka Express, is up and running in ______ after two years of construction. It was built by China at a cost of $3.8bn.
